vulnerabilities.title: Code Injection
vulnerabilities.description: Tainted data from user input reaches dangerous sink without sanitization. Sanitize user input before code injection.
vulnerabilities.code_snippet:
# CWE-749: Exposed Dangerous Method (would need Flask context but testing pattern)
def dangerous_eval():
    code = "print('hello')"
    return eval(code)  # Dangerous method

    return eval(code)  # Dangerous method

vulnerabilities.title: SSTI via render_template_string
vulnerabilities.description: SSTI via render_template_string
vulnerabilities.code_snippet:
# CWE-94: SSTI via jinja2
    template = Template(user_input)

vulnerabilities.title: Command Injection in executeCommand method
vulnerabilities.description: The `executeCommand` method takes user input and uses it directly in the `Runtime.getRuntime().exec()` call, which can lead to command injection if the user input is not properly sanitized. For example, if the user inputs a malicious command like `"rm -rf /"`, this could delete the entire file system.

vulnerabilities.title: SQL Injection in queryDatabase method
vulnerabilities.description: The `queryDatabase` method constructs a SQL query with user input directly, which can lead to SQL injection if the user input is not properly sanitized. For example, if the user inputs `"admin' OR '1'='1"` as the username, this could bypass the authentication check and access all users in the database.

vulnerabilities.title: XSS in executeCommand method
vulnerabilities.description: The `executeCommand` method uses the user input directly in the `Runtime.getRuntime().exec()` call, which can lead to cross-site scripting if the user input is not properly sanitized. For example, if the user inputs `"<script>alert('XSS')</script>"`, this could execute arbitrary JavaScript code on the client side.

vulnerabilities.title: Path Traversal in queryDatabase method
vulnerabilities.description: The `queryDatabase` method constructs a SQL query with user input directly, which can lead to path traversal if the user input is not properly sanitized. For example, if the user inputs `"../../etc/passwd"` as the username, this could access sensitive files on the server.

vulnerabilities.title: Admin Panel without Authentication Decorator
vulnerabilities.description:
The `admin_panel` function does not have any authentication decorator. This means that anyone can access the admin panel without proper authentication.

vulnerabilities.title: Hardcoded Credentials
vulnerabilities.description: The `DB_PASSWORD` and `AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID` are hardcoded in the code, which makes them vulnerable to exposure if the code is deployed in a public environment. These credentials should be stored securely and not hard-coded.
vulnerabilities.code_snippet:
const app = express();

// CWE-798: Hardcoded Credentials

vulnerabilities.title: SQL Injection
vulnerabilities.description: The SQL query constructed from user input (`req.params.id`) is vulnerable to SQL injection. This can be exploited by an attacker to manipulate the query and retrieve sensitive data or execute arbitrary SQL commands.

vulnerabilities.title: Command Injection
vulnerabilities.description: The `exec` function is used to run a command with user input (`req.params.id`). This can be exploited by an attacker to execute arbitrary commands on the server.

vulnerabilities.title: XSS
vulnerabilities.description: The `fs.readFile` function is used to read a file with user input (`req.params.id`). This can be exploited by an attacker to inject malicious HTML into the response.

vulnerabilities.title: Path Traversal
vulnerabilities.description: The `fs.readFile` function is used to read a file with user input (`req.params.id`). This can be exploited by an attacker to traverse directories and access sensitive files.

vulnerabilities.title: IDOR
vulnerabilities.description: The code does not perform any checks on the user input before accessing it. This can be exploited by an attacker to access sensitive data that they do not have permission to access.

vulnerabilities.title: Missing HTTPS
vulnerabilities.description: Missing HTTPS

vulnerabilities.title: Hardcoded Credentials in Source Code
vulnerabilities.description: The application hardcodes the password "password" in the `app.get('/search')` route. This is a clear example of a hardcoded credential, which can be exploited by an attacker to gain access to the system.

vulnerabilities.title: Hardcoded Credentials in Source Code
vulnerabilities.description: The application hardcodes the API key "api_key" in the `app.get('/execute')` route. This is another clear example of a hardcoded credential, which can be exploited by an attacker to gain access to the system.

vulnerabilities.title: Weak Cryptography in Passwords
vulnerabilities.description: The application uses MD5 for password hashing, which is considered weak. This can be exploited by an attacker to crack the passwords.

vulnerabilities.title: Missing Authentication in Sensitive Operations
vulnerabilities.description: The application does not perform any authentication before accessing sensitive routes like `/search` and `/execute`. This can be exploited by an attacker to gain access to these routes without proper authorization.

vulnerabilities.description: Debug Mode in Production

vulnerabilities.title: Integer Overflow in Price Calculation
vulnerabilities.description:
In the `checkout` function, there is no overflow check on the multiplication of `quantity` and `price`. This can lead to an integer overflow if the user sets `quantity` to a very large number (e.g., \(2^{31}\)), resulting in a negative total. If the total exceeds zero, the customer will be charged, which could be exploited for financial gain.

vulnerabilities.title: Command Injection in executeCommand function
vulnerabilities.description: The `executeCommand` function takes user input and constructs a command to be executed using `os/exec`. This is vulnerable to command injection because the user input is directly concatenated into the command string without proper sanitization. An attacker could manipulate the user input to execute arbitrary commands on the system.

vulnerabilities.title: SQL Injection in queryUser function
vulnerabilities.description: The `queryUser` function takes a username as input and constructs an SQL query to retrieve user data from the database. This is vulnerable to SQL injection because the username is directly concatenated into the query string without proper sanitization. An attacker could manipulate the username to execute arbitrary SQL commands on the database.

vulnerabilities.title: Weak Cryptography in hashPassword function
vulnerabilities.description: The `hashPassword` function takes a password as input and hashes it using MD5. This is vulnerable to weak cryptography because MD5 is considered insecure for hashing passwords. An attacker could use rainbow tables or other methods to crack the hashed password.

vulnerabilities.title: Hardcoded Credentials in hashPassword function
vulnerabilities.description: The `hashPassword` function takes a password as input and hashes it using MD5. This is vulnerable to hardcoding credentials because the password is directly hardcoded into the function without proper validation or encryption.

vulnerabilities.description: Hardcoded Credentials in executeCommand function

vulnerabilities.title: Hardcoded Credentials
vulnerabilities.description: In the `use_credentials` method, the password is hardcoded in the `params[:user]` hash. This makes it vulnerable to SQL injection attacks if an attacker can manipulate the input.

vulnerabilities.title: Weak Cryptography
vulnerabilities.description: The password is stored in plain text, which is a security risk. It should be hashed using a strong cryptographic algorithm like bcrypt or Argon2.

vulnerabilities.title: Debug Mode
vulnerabilities.description: Debug mode is enabled in the `create_user` method, which can expose sensitive information to attackers. It should be disabled in production environments.

vulnerabilities.title: Unsafe Deserialization
vulnerabilities.description: The `deserialize_data` method uses `Marshal.load(data)`, which can lead to arbitrary code execution if the data is not properly sanitized. It should be replaced with a safer deserialization library like JSON or YAML.

vulnerabilities.title: Hardcoded Credentials
vulnerabilities.description: The API key is hardcoded in the `params[:user]` hash. This makes it vulnerable to command injection attacks if an attacker can manipulate the input.

vulnerabilities.title: Weak Cryptography
vulnerabilities.description: The API key is stored in plain text, which is a security risk. It should be hashed using a strong cryptographic algorithm like bcrypt or Argon2.

vulnerabilities.title: Debug Mode
vulnerabilities.description: Debug mode is enabled in the `create_user` method, which can expose sensitive information to attackers. It should be disabled in production environments.
